MouseEventMetaKey.summary: The MouseEvent.metaKey read-only property is a boolean value that indicates whether the <kbd>meta</kbd> key was pressed or not when a given mouse event occurs.

remarks.para:
Be aware that many operating systems bind special functionality to the <kbd>meta</kbd> key, so this property may be false even when the key is actually pressed.
On Windows, for example, this key may open the Start menu.

blockquote.para:
Note: On Macintosh keyboards, this key is the <kbd>command</kbd> key (<kbd>⌘</kbd>).
On Windows keyboards, this key is the Windows key (<kbd>⊞</kbd>).

MouseEventMetaKey.value: A boolean value, where true indicates that the key is pressed, and false indicates that the key is not pressed.
